answers.answer: I can only tell you I once had a customer at one of the health food stores I managed who was told his liver was going to fail and he'd be dead in a few months.  That was about twenty years before I met him.  He took a bunch of supplements he researched, and despite his diabetes, the liver problem, etc., he was still going strong into his seventies.  I would talk to everyone -- a naturopath, a holistic nutritionist, medical specialists, and don't give up until the body does.  We only know something was inevitable in hindsight.

question: My husband has impending liver failure due to excessive alcohol intake, which has stopped.  His BUN and creatinine is just slightly elevated.  When I asked the GI doc who specializes in Liver DZ, he stated, "his liver is failing and it's normal for the kidneys to follow."  How can I help stop this?
title: hepatic/renal diet
